corrective action plan.

completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
FOM 801-03 Medical Passport
All medical information within the medical passport
must be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect
the child’s current and complete health information.
One of three foster care case files reviewed one did not have a complete medical
passport with medical information on the passport.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency was advised to place updated service plan documents in
MiSACWIS under the case service plan documents with the PATP’s.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD

There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The CA reported that this is a new program, and they are just getting cases and
hiring staff for the program. They have eight unlicensed relative placements. The
unlicensed relatives are not interested in being licensed at this time. The agency
CA reported they have had some difficulties in working within the confines of the
CWLM system. They reported helpdesk tickets has a slow turnaround.
Financial Overview
The agency provided their annual budget. A copy of the nonprofit tax return from
the previous fiscal year was reviewed. This license was reviewed for a six month
original therefore a yearly audit was not required.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has no safety issues.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency had two safety alerts with two different unlicensed relative homes. First
Concern: The unlicensed relative and the baby was currently sleeping in a
mechanical/utility room where the furnace, water heater, washer and dryer are
placed. There is no operable carbon monoxide detector in the home. The smoke
detector was observed sitting on the TV stand. Resolution: An onsite home visit was
conducted on 5/20/2023 by the Licensing Manager. A safety plan was put in place,
reviewed, and signed by the unlicensed relative caregiver. The carbon monoxide
detector and smoke detector were installed and working. Sleep areas was adjusted
for compliance with the safety plan. Photos were taken to show compliance with all
safety concerns. Photos are attached to the safety alert.
Second safety alert: Concern: No operable carbon monoxide detector in the
unlicensed relative home. Resolution: On 5/20/23, the licensing Manager verified
that the carbon monoxide detector was installed and working in the home. Photo was
taken and place with the safety alert for verification.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that Christ Child Detroit will be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
